channel.title: Afterlife
channel.description: Hi everyone. I've been questioning afterlife for some time now and I want to know what you all think of what happens when you die. (Do not answer "Heaven" or "Hell" please) I'm pretty unsure, but I'm sort of leaning on the thought that you walk down a long tunnel and reach an amazing bright light, and you walk in, and you're filled with love and acceptance and just happiness. And everything is great, and you're reunited with your past family members who have deceased. But there's also the scientific explanation that your molecules reform and you become a whole new being or gender, race, etc. What's your opinion on the afterlife? Do you think there even [i]is[/i] an afterlife?

item.title: Afterlife
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

My Great Aunt, Died 3 or 4 times and was brought back to life. I asked her what it was like about 7 years ago (she passed away 3 years ago) and she told me she saw angels, personally I think she was lieing to me because I was at a younger age and just wanted to make me happy. I sometimes think I should of visited her before she died to ask her what she actually saw.

In my opinion its like going to bed and not waking up. Just deep sleep.

Read full topic

item.title: Afterlife
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

The “light” they see is made from the brain losing oxygen, causing this type of tunnel vision (at least I think its tunnel vision of some sort).

And jme, the fact that they have no recollection of anything seems to aid to another theory of mine (and others), which is rebirth as another being. My theory is that when we die, we are reborn as another being (still human, I just like saying being a lot) with absolutely no recollection of our past life. Apparently, there are a few who can remember previous lives (those people who can remember whole decks of cards,etc.). Still, it kinda scares me to think that we may be forever trapped on Earth. I’d personally prefer a never-ending dream or the astral plane over rebirth.

Read full topic

item.title: Afterlife
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:30, topic:331549”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=427927.msg3143531#msg3143531 date=1267843187]
We just stop existing. Like before you were born. Non-existent. I don’t think we will be in a state of consciousness where we know where were at. We will not know we are dead, not know anything, and probably not even have a state of consciousnesses at all. Just not there.
[/quote]
Thats what i was thinking but it just makes my head feel like theres a hole in it.

They did a survey for people with near death experiences or that have been dead shortly and all of them saw bright lights, even the ones that were atheist.[/quote]

On the other hand a lot of people are pronounced dead and revived minutes later, with no recollection/dreams/etc. I’d also like to see this survey, I couldn’t find anything like it.

Here are some good theories about near death experience phenomena:

en.wikipedia.org

Near-death experience

A near-death experience (NDE) is a personal experience associated with death or impending death. Such experiences may encompass a variety of sensations including detachment from the body, feelings of levitation, total serenity, security, warmth, the experience of absolute dissolution, and the presence of a light. NDEs are a recognized part of some transcendental and religious beliefs in an afterlife. Different models have been described to explain NDEs. Neuroscience research suggests that an NDE...

Read full topic

item.title: Afterlife
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

The same scenario plays in my head every time I think about death… You’re able to see, but only black because there’s no light. You don’t have a body, but rather floating head. It’s nothing physically as I explain it, but it is the way it seems. All you have to do is roam around the endless blackness…

Read full topic

item.title: Afterlife
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

ziplock:

We just stop existing. Like before you were born. Non-existent. I don’t think we will be in a state of consciousness where we know where were at. We will not know we are dead, not know anything, and probably not even have a state of consciousnesses at all. Just not there.

Thats what i was thinking but it just makes my head feel like theres a hole in it.

They did a survey for people with near death experiences or that have been dead shortly and all of them saw bright lights, even the ones that were atheist.

Who knows really? I just try not to think about it because i know its the only thing thats impossible to miss out on.

Read full topic

But there’s also the scientific explanation that your molecules reform and you become a whole new being or gender, race, etc.

[/quote]
if that happens when i die…i will be disappointed…[/quote]Same. I still believe in the astral plane though, for it is the only thing that actually makes real sense to me.

But the question of “where does your conscience go?” still ponders me, which is one of the main reasons I believe in the astral plane.

item.title: Afterlife
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“Rixxx, post:17, topic:331549”][quote author=r0ckstar96 link=topic=427927.msg3143050#msg3143050 date=1267795663]

Yeah, [quote author=r0ckstar96 link=topic=427927.msg3142241#msg3142241 date=1267683733]
(Do not answer “Heaven” or “Hell” please)
[/quote]And why not? It may be true.

Because that’s the default answer by any believers in God, so I’m trying to avoid them just saying Heaven and/or Hell.
I really don’t think it’s that true because, think of all of the religions out there in the world… You expect there to be that one perfect true religion? I don’t.
[/quote]
I hate religion wars.[/quote]

The crusade is coming!

Read full topic

item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

Lin:

The strange thing is everyone thinks the devil is in hell fucking everyone sent down there. However, there must be millions and millions of people actually sent there constantly. This makes no sense as to how he has time for every person down there, one at a time. And what about girls? What do they do? Just sit there in agony? Gah, poorly thought out fairytales make me frustrated…

nsfw: http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=8731346757105454561
